author: Sun Tzu
summary: The art of war is of vital importance to the State. It is governed by five constant factors: The Moral Law, Heaven, Earth, The Commander, and Method and discipline. All warfare is based on deception.
key_takeaways: War is a matter of life and death that demands careful study.
Five factors determine victory: Moral Law, Heaven, Earth, Commander, and Discipline.
All warfare is based on deception - appear weak when strong, far when near.

questions.question: According to Sun Tzu, what are the five constant factors that govern the art of war?

options.text: The Moral Law, Heaven, Earth, The Commander, Method and Discipline

questions.explanation: Sun Tzu identifies five constant factors: (1) The Moral Law, (2) Heaven, (3) Earth, (4) The Commander, and (5) Method and discipline. These should be familiar to every general.

questions.question: What does Sun Tzu mean when he says 'All warfare is based on deception'?

options.text: You should always lie to your enemies
When able to attack, appear unable; when near, appear far; use deception to create advantage
War is immoral and should be avoided

questions.explanation: Sun Tzu teaches that when able to attack, we must seem unable; when near, make the enemy believe we are far away. Hold out baits to entice the enemy, feign disorder, and crush him.

questions.question: A general who makes many calculations before battle will likely win, while one who makes few will likely lose. How does this apply to business strategy?

options.text: Business is completely different from war and this doesn't apply
Thorough planning, research, and strategic thinking before launching initiatives leads to better outcomes
Speed is more important than planning in business
Only military generals need to make calculations

questions.explanation: The general who wins a battle makes many calculations in his temple ere the battle is fought. Many calculations lead to victory, few calculations to defeat. This principle applies to business: thorough strategic planning before action improves success rates.
